channel.title: DemonClassic/RustyOnline src
channel.description:
Hi, i'm not sure who that person was trying to sell the last version i had of this, i don't even know if it was the last version i had that he was selling, anyway here it is.
I don't use this anymore, i won't give any help. This uses Demonik source.
Features that were different from other sources(if i can remember) are..
Point system Non tradeble/dualable/dropable items First Reborn/Second Reborn (custom feature i made) Party System (join/create party's share exp etc) (another custom feature) Dragon certificates that you exchange for armor at an npc Pk points you get, which you can spend on items from a shop Godspells (or though many servers have this now) Special items (such as donation bows, to shoot 2x faster and use no arrows etc) some new methods that i didn't find in demonik source to use.
that's all i can think of at the moment.
This is the source folder only, and the setup.ini file is where you can modify some settings, sit that in your main folder. Modify the paths in the variables at the top in util/INI.java
Download Link: http://uppit.com/J0Q2UR

item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:31, topic:224587”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=295091.msg4063808#msg4063808 date=1343683175]

Sorry for gravedigging. It’s just, I would really like to retrieve the source for this, as I’m wanting to create a point-based server. If anyone still has this and wouldn’t mind reuploading and posting it for me, that’d be great.

I’d recommend u to grab PeeKay src rather than this.
[/quote]
Is that based off this source? or what’s better in that than these 2?[/quote]
PeeKay is based on RSCD V.25 with clientsided control panel, when this is based on demonik with shitty npc point to xp conversion.

Read full topic

item.title: DemonClassic/RustyOnline src
item.dc:creator: @alexdevinson alexdevinson
item.description:
@alexdevinson wrote:

[quote=“public void mscpidiots(), post:24, topic:224587”][quote author=alexdevinson link=topic=295091.msg2410183#msg2410183 date=1219884408]

No there aren’t mac versions for this

It’s JAVA - it’s platform independent. You have to use Terminal to start the client/server.
[/quote]Well, not mac configured as in batch files configured for it.[/quote]

A Batch file is nothing more than a series of commands, which in fact, are the same across all platforms.

ant runls is the same on windows as it is on Linux, Mac, or any other command line interface. All you need is to have the bin directory in the executing path.

No use running batch files anyway, you never catch the errors.

Read full topic
